result.execSummary:
The defendant Adolph F. Brown Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previsouly proveded).
**Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  Perform 50 hrs of community service work for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.    May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Adolph F. Brown, appeared with Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld; Deft. placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  Credit for 153 days if revoked.  As a condition DE is ordered to complete 50 hours of community service.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Adolph F. Brown, appeared with Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Court vacates bench warrant and reinstates bond.  Atty Lassiter requests a new date for sentencing due to her busy calendar this afternoon; no objection by the State.  Sentencing on 1/29/15 at 11:15 AM.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter appeared appeared on behalf of the defendant who does not appear.
Defendant fails to appear in court.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $5000 Cash Bond but will stay the warrant until 5PM tomorrow at which time bond will also be forfeited.
Sentencing hearing on January 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Due to a motion hearing already scheduled for 1/8 at 11:30 AM; Sentencing moved to 1/7/15 at 1:30 PM and confirmed with Atty Lassiter.
Sentencing hearing on January 8, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Due to a continued jury trial; Sentencing rescheduled to 1/8/15 at 11:30 AM and confirmed with Atty Lassiter
Deft signed bond, co signer was father.

ADDRESS INFO for Adolph F. Brown Jr.
Current: 3847 Green St  #1, Racine, WI 53402 United States  (Effective: 10-22-2014)
Prior: 4624 36th Avenue #1, Kenosha, WI 53144
Not to possess or consume alcohol.    *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  Must reside with Adolph Brown Sr upon release.
Signed by deft's father only.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter appeared on behalf of defendant who is in custody and not present in court.  Clerk: PT
Due to calendar congestion court unable to proceed to sentencing today.  Arguments heard on bond and Atty Lassiter requests a signature bond and states Deft. will be residing with his father who is present in court.  Upon hearing arguments Court modifies bond to a $5000 Signature Bond and orders Deft's father, Adolph Brown Sr. to guarantee defendant's appearance on 11/12/14 at 3:30 PM and defendant is ordered to reside with his father upon his release.   Adolph Brown, Sr. acknowledges and also signs bond guaranteeing deft.'s appearance at next hearing.
by agent Adriane Wilder

Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards specially for Attorney Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Atty Lassiter is out ill today.  Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Count 1 - Deft. pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 10/22/14 at 3:30 PM.

Defendant Adolph F. Brown appeared with Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, def. in the Living Free Program and no offer rec'd yet.  Matter set over, bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Atty C Lassiter.
Atty:  C Lassiter.

Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Carmen Lassiter. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 4. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 7-31-14 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
